Chapter 1, Part 2: The Wise Guardian Elder Furthermore, elder!
The establishment of the roots of dharmas such as craving is a great suffering that is gathered in the world.
There are ten kinds of dharmas with craving as their root.
What are the ten?

First, due to the condition of craving, one gives rise to seeking; second, due to the condition of seeking, one gives rise to attachment; third, due to the condition of craving, one gives rise to the view of self; fourth, due to the condition of the view of self, one grasps as definite; fifth, due to the condition of grasping as definite, one gives rise to desire and craving; sixth, due to the condition of desire and craving, one gives rise to attachment; seventh, due to the condition of attachment, one gives rise to stinginess; eighth, due to the condition of stinginess, one grasps; ninth, due to the condition of grasping, one does not guard; tenth, due to the condition of not guarding, one gives rise to suffering. Because of not guarding, one holds swords and sticks, fights and quarrels. Due to this cause, one gives rise to many kinds of evil dharmas such as two-facedness.

Seeing these ten kinds of dharmas with craving as their root that are gathered in the world, I wish to establish the dharma without a root. Therefore, I have left home with pure faith and am heading towards the attainment of the fruit of anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
Sentient beings are swallowed by craving, pursuing this and that,
Obtaining profit, greed, and the view of self, what is received is considered certain.
This matter I should do, thus desire and greed increase,
Desire and greed having increased, attachment arises and stinginess is born.
The faults of stinginess in the world, firmly grasped and adhered to,
Because of grasping, one does not guard, and the appearance of offenses continues.
The foolish, because of not guarding, take up knives and sticks to harm,
Widely creating various evil deeds, later suffering increases and grows.
Craving as a condition increases and grows, then various sufferings are born,
I realize supreme enlightenment, causing them to abide in the rootless.
Furthermore, elder!
The worldly accumulation of the dharmas of the heterodox assembly is extremely painful.
There are ten heterodox dharmas.
What are the ten?

First, wrong views; second, wrong thought; third, wrong speech; fourth, wrong action; fifth, wrong livelihood; sixth, wrong effort; seventh, wrong mindfulness; eighth, wrong concentration; ninth, wrong liberation; tenth, wrong knowledge.

These ten kinds of wrong and fixed aggregates of dharmas are gathered in the world, and this suffering is very great. Having seen this, I universally transcend all wrong dharmas. For this reason, I have gone forth with pure faith to realize the fruit of anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi.
At that time the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
Wrong views are contained, the realm of wrong thought,
Speaking the wrong language, giving rise to various wrong actions.
Wrong livelihood and wrong effort, wrong mindfulness and wrong concentration,
Giving rise to that wrong liberation, single-mindedly producing wrong knowledge.
These various wrong and fixed aggregates, the foolish ones establish,
To cause them to turn away from evil and enter the correct path, therefore I went forth.
Furthermore, elder,

The deep and dangerous evil paths that people in the world accumulate lead to great suffering, gradually heading towards evil destinies, increasing evil destinies, and expanding evil destinies. Namely, there are ten kinds of unwholesome actions.
What are the ten?

First, killing living beings; second, stealing; third, sexual misconduct; fourth, false speech; fifth, divisive speech; sixth, harsh speech; seventh, frivolous speech; eighth, greed; ninth, hatred; tenth, wrong views.

These ten kinds of unwholesome actions gradually lead to evil destinies, increase evil destinies, and expand evil destinies. Seeing this, I went forth with pure faith in order to escape from these dangerous evil paths and attain the fruit of supreme perfect enlightenment.
At that time the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
Sentient beings give rise to killing, and encroach upon and take others' wealth,
Desire, sexual misconduct, and pervasive misconduct, quickly fall into hell.
Two tongues and harsh words, false speech without certainty,
The foolish one's ornate speech, ordinary beings bound by afflictions.
Greedy mind delights in others' wealth, hatred gives rise to faults,
Wrong views destroy much, will fall into evil destinies.
The body has three kinds of offenses, the speech has four kinds that should be known,
The mind has three offenses as well, the doer falls into evil destinies.
If one commits offenses, will definitely fall into evil destinies,
If one leaves these three offenses, will certainly not fall into evil destinies.
Furthermore, elder!
The defilements, secondary defilements, and various tainted impurities of the world, this suffering is very great.ğŸ”½There are ten kinds of defilements.
What are the ten?

First, the defilement of stinginess; second, the defilement of violating precepts; third, the defilement of anger; fourth, the defilement of laziness; fifth, the defilement of distraction; sixth, the defilement of evil wisdom; seventh, the defilement of lack of learning; eighth, the defilement of doubt; ninth, the defilement of lack of faith and understanding; tenth, the defilement of lack of respect.

These ten kinds of defiled dharmas are accumulated in the world. Having seen this, I universally cause them to abide in the undefiled dharmas. Therefore, I have left home with pure faith to attain the fruit of anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi.
At that time the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
The dharmas of the continuity of the world, the ten defilements oppress,
Attached to the defilements of conditioned existence, for a while without fatigue.
The foolish and ordinary beings, defiled by the stain of stinginess,
The training in precepts subsumes sentient beings, but they are destroyed and not complete.
The foolish turn their backs on patience, are lazy and weak in diligence,
Are unable to stabilize their minds, have evil wisdom and are dull.
Parents, elders, and teachers are all abandoned,
Not seeing the world's light, evil wisdom gives rise to doubts.
The Buddha speaks the profound Dharma, but slander arises,
Covered by the Dharma of deluded darkness, the holy Dharma is not respected.
Seeing the defiled dharmas, one is not attached to the conditioned,
The unconditioned is undefiled, causing sentient beings to be tranquil.
Furthermore, elder!
The fear of birth and death, the accumulation of the world, this suffering is very great.
This has ten kinds.
What are the ten?

First, stinginess and jealousy cover and form knots, this suffering is very great; second, the division of ignorance always entangles the Dharma, this suffering is very great; third, the overflowing sea of desire, this suffering is very great; fourth, the difficulties in desire destroy the limbs and joints, this suffering is very great; fifth, the entanglements of affection and love are shot by the arrow of desire, this suffering is very great; sixth, the smoke and dust of anger and resentment fill the air, and the flames of anger flare up, this suffering is very great; seventh, the burning of the fire of greed, this suffering is very great; eighth, the concealment of the poison of anger, this suffering is very great; ninth, the thorns of the obstructions of ignorance, this suffering is very great; tenth, the dangers and fears of the wilderness of birth and death, the entanglements and bonds that follow, this suffering is very great.
Seeing these ten kinds of dharmas, I wish to eliminate them, and therefore I have left home with pure faith, aiming to realize the fruit of anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi.
At that time, the World-Honored One, using the above meaning, spoke a verse again:
Birth, youth, and old age devour, and destroy the form into formlessness,
Without mindfulness and wisdom, the door of decline - this Dharma can destroy the characteristics of the world.
Sickness devours form and strength, and destroys power and vigor,
And further diminishes the faculties, with inferior strength and no reliance.
The fear of death is like the roar of a rÄká¹£asa, always following living beings,
When the time comes, life ends without loving-kindness, destroying the life force of the world.
The laws of old age, sickness, and death are extremely fierce, disturbing living beings in the world,
The door to the bliss of being free from old age and death - I go forth to diligently seek.
The three fires burn the world, and I do not see a savior for the world,
I give rise to the mind to save and protect the world, wishing to sprinkle sweet rain to extinguish the fires.
The correct path of the world is all destroyed, without eyes, confused and deluded,
I wish to open the pure eyes and bestow them upon sentient beings, leaving the household life and revealing the correct path.
The doubts that arise in the minds of sentient beings are then covered by various hindrances,
I vow to remove the mind of evil deeds, therefore leaving the household life and proclaiming the correct Dharma.
Sentient beings give rise to mutual opposition, seeking out faults and destroying each other,
Therefore I leave the household life to benefit the world, universally wishing for sentient beings to cease their anger and hatred.
Parents in the world are extremely loving and close, but sentient beings give rise to arrogant minds and do not respect them,
Wishing to crush the banner of arrogance, therefore leaving the household life to be a refuge.
I see sentient beings covered by greed, due to the conditions of wealth and possessions they come to ruin,
If they can obtain the seven kinds of spiritual wealth, they should enable the world to be free from poverty and suffering.
Without benefit, they sustain themselves,
Certainly destroying their own bodies, Therefore I cause them to leave the three existences.
Foolish people do not understand what is beneficial, In this way, they fill the three realms,
I wish to benefit them, so I leave the household life, And will show the world the correct and righteous Dharma.
Sentient beings are addicted to the hells, I see them undergoing extreme suffering,
Various evil poisons are vast and boundless, I leave the household life in order to cause them to be liberated.
Sentient beings give rise to mutual killing, And return to the realms of animals,
Out of compassion and vows, I leave the household life, To be a refuge for sentient beings without one.
I see the sentient beings in the realm of hungry ghosts, Undergoing the extreme suffering of hunger and thirst,
I will attain supreme great enlightenment, And universally bestow the supreme nectar-like food.
The great suffering of pursuing in the human realm, the extreme increase of suffering in the heavenly realm upon passing away,
Fully understanding the profound suffering of the three realms, I left home to save and liberate.
In the world, there are those without shame, confused and deluded by desire, harming sentient beings,
Not discriminating between relatives and elders, desire swallowing and consuming them like pigs and dogs.
Attached to desire, controlled by women, I see sentient beings bound by desire,
Giving rise to meaningless and harmful intoxicated minds, I left home to save and protect.
Sentient beings are destroyed and not in control, terrified until death without liberation,
After I left home and attained enlightenment, I universally awakened them all to be in control.
In the white-robed households, there is no meaning or benefit, I see hundreds of thousands of kinds of faults,
I now transform these regions, causing them all to leave the brink of birth and death.
At that time, the five hundred elders headed by BhadrapÄla, having heard the Buddha's teachings, gave rise to extraordinary thoughts and all said:
The Buddha's enlightenment is vast. We now know that the Buddha is the true enlightenment.
Then the elders spoke in unison, saying in verse:
We five hundred elders, out of fear of old age, have come to take refuge in the Buddha.
We pray that you will expound the supreme and excellent Dharma gate, enabling us to escape the suffering of old age and death to its very end.
The World-Honored One's perfect and pure characteristics are pure, and he has already escaped the three existences and attained liberation.
He saves and delivers the three existences from the gate of formation and destruction, freeing them from the abode of the three existences and enabling them to be self-mastered.
Free from greed, liberated, fearless, free from dust, with a pure mind free from defilements,
The unsurpassed great guide who skillfully tames, opens up the unsurpassed nectar-like Dharma.
The unsurpassed hero abides in the supreme characteristics, unequaled in the heavens and human realms,
The unequaled one, the honored one in the world, expounds the supreme great compassionate Dharma.
Having exhausted all faults and severed the three defilements, endowed with pure eyes, free from darkness and obscurity,
The net of dust, darkness, and delusion is completely removed, and the boundless dust-free Dharma is proclaimed.
Compassionately pitying the world without reliance, in the three realms of existence, he lifts them up,
In the mind of compassion, he gives rise to the mind of great kindness, quickly causing them to leave and abide in goodness.
The ocean of birth and death of arrogance, delusion, and evil, the waves of illness, suffering, and harm,
The sentient beings drowning without rescue, the Buddha, out of compassion, saves and delivers them.
The Buddha's body is pure like a golden mountain, fully endowed with a hundred kinds of supreme majestic light,
With the most delicious and supreme great Brahma voice, he proclaims the supreme Dharma with wonderful jeweled language.
The intrinsic nature of all dharmas is pure, originally bright, and purity is the same,
Uncreated, created, and receiving, also not lost, for the sake of the unhearing, well explain.
The good practiced by the one with boundless fame, the natural wisdom of the ten powers and fearlessness,
The mind equal to space, wisdom boundless, well explain the vow of the Å›ramaá¹‡a.
At that time the World-Honored One had this thought:

The wholesome roots of these five hundred elders are mature. I should now speak the true Dharma according to their abilities, causing this place to transform from a household of white-robed laypeople into the appearance of renunciant monks, exhausting all contaminations and reaching the end of existence.
At that time the World-Honored One then rose up into the air and sat cross-legged.
At that time the five hundred elders deeply gave rise to love and pure faith and respect for the Buddha, World-Honored One, and made various offerings, practicing good and intimacy.
At that time the World-Honored One said to the five hundred elders:
You elders!

The ten kinds of disturbing phenomena in the world, such as birth, old age, sickness, death, worry, sorrow, suffering, distress, lamentation, and transmigration, do you all wish to seek liberation from these?

Moreover, the ten kinds of harmful events in the world, such as the unbeneficial arising of what is loved and what is not loved, whether already done, being done, or to be done, do you all wish to seek liberation from these?

The ten kinds of evil views in the world, such as the views of self, person, sentient being, life, annihilation, permanence, non-action, no cause, inequality, and wrong views, do you all wish to seek liberation from these?

The ten great arrows of illness in the world, such as love, ignorance, desire, greed, anger, delusion, arrogance, views, formation, and decay, do you all wish to seek liberation from these?ğŸ”½Here, what are the ten great arrows of illness? They are: 1. Love, 2. Ignorance, 3. Desire, 4. Greed, 5. Anger, 6. Delusion, 7. Arrogance, 8. Views, 9. Formation, 10. Decay.

Moreover, the fundamental dharmas of love in the world are as follows: because of love, there is pursuit; because of pursuit, there is craving; because of craving, there is the view of self; because of the view of self, there is determination; because of determination, there is lustful desire; because of lustful desire, there is attachment; because of attachment, there is stinginess; because of stinginess, there is grasping; because of grasping, there is lack of protection; because of lack of protection, there is the arising of suffering. Do you each wish to seek liberation from these ten kinds of fundamental dharmas of love?

Moreover, the dharmas of the heterodox aggregate in the world are as follows: heterodox views, heterodox thought, heterodox speech, heterodox action, heterodox livelihood, heterodox effort, heterodox mindfulness, heterodox concentration, heterodox liberation, and heterodox cognition. Do you each wish to seek liberation from these ten kinds of dharmas of the heterodox aggregate?
